item.description: <p>N﻿early 48,000 people gave a moving tribute to those who put their lives on the line during the Bondi terror attack.</p>

item.title: Man, 34, drowns at Jervis Bay beach
item.description: <p>The 34-year-old man was one of multiple people who got into trouble at Greenpatch Beach at 4.45pm yesterday.</p>

item.title: Trump says US is taking control of Venezuela's oil reserves. Here's what it means
item.description: <p>Venezuela is sitting on a massive 303 billion barrels worth of crude – about a fifth of the world&#x27;s global reserves, according to the US Energy Information Administration (EIA). </p>

item.title: US military operation in Venezuela disrupts Caribbean holiday travel, hundreds of flights cancelled
item.description: <p>major airlines cancelled hundreds of flights across the eastern Caribbean region and warned passengers that disruptions could continue for days</p>

item.title: The US has captured Venezuelan leader Maduro. Here's what to know
item.description: <p>Donald Trump said that Nicolas Maduro and his wife were aboard the USS Iwo Jima heading to New York.</p>

item.title: Who is Nicolas Maduro? From bus driver to Venezuela president
item.description: <p>Nicolás Maduro rose from unionised bus driver to Venezuelan president and oversaw his country&#x27;s democratic undoing and economic collapse.</p>

item.title: Operation Absolute Resolve: Inside the US mission to capture Maduro
item.description: <p>US intelligence agencies tracked the Venezuelan president for months to &quot;understand how he moved, where he lived, where he traveled, what he ate, what he wore&quot;.</p>

item.title: Why is the US attacking Venezuela? Timeline of events leading up to president's capture
item.description: <p>The strike on the third day of 2026 is a dramatic escalation after months of Donald Trump increasing pressure on Nicolas Maduro.</p>

item.title: Australia issues South American travel warnings after US strikes Venezuela
item.description: <p>C﻿lear instructions have been issued for Australians who are still in two South American nations.</p>

item.title: Trump attacked Venezuela and arrested its president. Is that legal?
item.description: <p>A full explanation of the claimed justification has yet to be issued, but the early signs are characteristically confusing.</p>

item.title: Venezuela's VP Delcy Rodriguez demands release of Maduro and wife, condemns 'illegitimate kidnapping' in telev
item.description: <p>Delcy Rodriguez called for calm and unity, before contradicting Donald Trump&#x27;s earlier claims that she had been sworn in as president of Venezuela.</p>

item.title: Who is Cilia Flores, Maduro's wife and 'first combatant' of Venezuelan socialism?
item.description: <p>Captured along with Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro was his wife and top adviser, Cilia Flores, who was dragged from their bedroom along with her husband by US troops. </p>

item.title: Manhunt after Sydney man kidnapped, stabbed, left tied up in car
item.description: <p>Police will allege the man was taken from Military Road in Guilford yesterday afternoon, and stabbed, burnt and beaten over the course of 12 hours.﻿</p>

item.title: Man dies after stolen car drives over road spikes in South Australia
item.description: <p>A man has died after a stolen car crashed in regional South Australia, having allegedly reached speeds of 180km/h during a police pursuit.</p>

item.title: Sporting stars join call for royal commission into Bondi terror attack
item.description: <p>More than 60 Australian sporting stars have joined the chorus calling for a federal royal commission into the Bondi terror attack, antisemitism and radicalisation.</p>

item.title: Armed men fight on busy Melbourne freeway after crash
item.description: <p>Phone video shows one of the men approaching a family car.</p>

item.title: World leaders react with condemnation and caution after US captures Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro
item.description: <p>The response from many foreign governments around the world – including Australia ﻿– have been measured.</p>

item.title: Captured president walked through detention office in New York
item.description: ﻿A plane carrying the deposed leader landed around 4.30pm on Saturday (local time) at an airport in New Yor...

item.title: Venezuelans wonder who's in charge as Trump claims contact with Maduro's deputy
item.description: <p>Venezuelans are scrambling to understand who is in charge of their country after the US military captured President Nicolás Maduro.</p>

item.title: Maduro's capture sparks celebrations among Venezuelans
item.description: <p>For some Venezuelan natives, the military action brought their dreams of reuniting with loved ones closer to reality after years of heartbreaking separations.</p>

item.title: Secretary of State Marco Rubio denies US will 'run' Venezuela despite President Donald Trump's comments
item.description: <p>T﻿he Secretary of State said captured leader Nicolas Maduro&#x27;s deputies would be allowed to govern.</p>
